that is situated along I-70, 35 miles west of
, and home to the University of Kansas.  Lawrence provides a mix of academics, bohemia, and small-town Kansas kitsch.

The K-10 Connector runs between Overland Park and Lawrence.

value: .  Provides daily service via the Southwest Chief

route.  The westbound train (from Chicago bound for Los Angeles) stops at 12:32AM and the Eastbound train (from LA to Chicago) stops at 5:49AM. There are no bus stops directly at the train station, the next stops are about 8 miles southwest on 9th Street (Bus 1 on New York, Bus 7, 3, 6, 10, 11 from New Hampshire). See also the

(MCI) 46 miles east-northeast.  The closest airport to Lawrence with commercial airlines operating, and a major Southwest hub.  Service also available on major airlines to large domestic hubs (Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Washington, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Minneapolis, Memphis, Detroit, Salt Lake City, Cincinnati, Cleveland, New York, Houston)
(LWC) A small airfiled, no scheduled service, only corporate and private jets.

Lawrence has a fairly good and inexpensive bus system, see the bus section below for more info.

The city is also relatively bike-friendly and has had a good reputation among the biking community.

The central part of the city, consisting of the downtown, the KU campus, and the student-filled neighborhoods in between is easily walkable.  The Lawrence Convention & Visitors Bureau's Visitor Information Center offers brochures
for self-guided walking tours in the city. Outside of the central part of the city, cars are king. Cabs are cheap, though uncommon.
The lawrence transit bus system is known as the T. The fare is only $1 and will get you one transfer or you can pay $2.75 for a day pass. the website is on
and there a bus to the overland park campus
. The transit stops are on google transit and searchable there, except for the k-10 connector.

on North Side of the river which was created by local artist Stan Herd. It is visible from the Massachusetts Street Bridge.

See a film, theatre production, live concert, art show, wedding or any number of other things at the multifunctional
, on the corner of 7th and Massachusetts.  (Serves Free State Beer on tap, including during films)

value: content=If you haven't seen the Jayhawks play in the heart of basketball season, you're missing out on one of the best events in the area, even if you're not a huge basketball fan. People from all over Kansas come to Allen Fieldhouse to cheer on this nationally acclaimed team that has been to countless Final Fours and Sweet Sixteens in its long history. Make sure you buy tickets well in advance, since they sell out fast. It should be noted that during
Kansas Men's basketball game, home or away, Massachusetts Street will be alive with people.
. visits many of the sites involved Quantrill's Raid (The Lawrence Massacre) in 1863. You can also see many of these sites on the Quantrill's Raid
prepared by the Lawrence Convention & Visitors Bureau.
is located just outside of town and provides opportunities for boating, fishing, hiking, hunting, and camping.
.  Home of the Spencer Museum of Art
, the Museum of Natural History (Dyche Hall
, including the Panorama of North American Mammals and Comanche, the "Lone Survivor" of the Battle of Little Bighorn), and the Dole Institute of Politics

Massachusetts Street is the downtown shopping district.  One can find anything from incense burners to sporting goods.  Allergy sufferers, take note: several local merchants (The Dusty Bookshelf, Love Garden Sounds, and Sunflower Outdoor) have resident cats. The 23rd street in the south has many shopping places and Iowa/31th Street is home to Walmart and Co.

value: , +1 785-842-1212 - Dirt cheap, open late.  Everybody's top choice for post-bar dining.
content=Great Pizza. Open Late. City-wide Delivery. Everyday Walk-In Special
, 719 Massachusetts, +1 785 841-6400.  Barbecue joint locally known for its large portions.
content= Grocery store specializing in natural and vegetarian/vegan foods. Also has a cafe and juice bar.
content=Authentic Indian food. Lunch buffet every day.
content=Chinese and Vietnamese food. Delivery available for orders over $10.
content= Build your own entree and watch the chef stir fry it. Chinese buffet available too.
name=JB Stout's Sports Bar and Grill
content=Steaks, sandwiches and other bar food. Great place to watch a game or play pool.
Sixth Street and Wakarusa Drive, +1 785 312-9057.  Somewhat upscale, features seafood dishes and an extensive tequila selection.
, 800 New Hampshire, +1 785 841-0990.  Fine dining, new menu every month.  $2 Pints every day of the week serving REAL beer!
, 704 Massachusetts, +1 785 749-0055.  Unassuming location with the best pizza in town.  Free delivery.
, 1014 Massachusetts, +1 785 832-8323.  Best ice cream in town.
content= Great date restaurant with American and Italian food.
content=Thai and Chinese food in what used to be a Subway (really).
content=Locally owned sandwich shop with a number of vegetarian options. Delivery available.
, 811 Massachusetts, +1 785 832-0001.  Thai, Nepalese, and Japanese noodle shop.  Prices are low, and the atmosphere is casual.
address=17 West 9th Street (Between Weavers and Wheat Fields)
directions=From any part of town go to 9th and Massachusetts, then head west towards 9th and Iowa (up the hill).  A.B's is on your left between Massachusetts and Vermont.

content=A.B's is a cool little crepes and coffee shop.  The owner is SUPER friendly...he loves to talk.  The only problem is that the hours are non-consistent, so you have to check the white board every week. Recommended Items:  The Jason.
content=Specializes in Asian-American food, as well as bubble tea.  Karaoke rooms available.

Lawrence has a varied nightlife with a number of opportunities to see live music. For a calendar of upcoming shows, visit Lawrence.com

value: content= Live music venue featuring a range of local and national rock music.
content= This microbrewery and eatery claims to be the 'First Legal Brewery in Kansas'. Monday nights offer $1.50 pints of tasty microbrew.
, 1016 Massachusetts, +1 785 865-4055. A place to have a beer and enjoy some live music most nights of the week. Wednesday nights are the busiest here and usually have the best drink specials.
, 1009 Mass, +1 785-843-9032. One of the few Lawrence bars frequented by both locals and students, featuring pool tables, foosball, and a double-decker heated outdoor smoking deck.
content=Lawrence's original coffee bar is in a small brick building on 9th Street, just east of Massachusetts Street downtown.

content=Is Lawrence's home for local and national punk and indie rock. It's also has a collection of pinball machines and a large heated smoking porch to keep you from shivering while you smoke and swill your $1 PBR.

content= The Eldridge Hotel is on the National Register of Historic Places - as one of the buildings that Quantrill burned during his raid of the city in 1863. It was renovated in the spring of 2005. Room rates climb higher the weekend of KU graduation.

content=A lovely bed and breakfast with rooms to suit most budgets. Within walking distance to the city center (and all the shopping and eateries on Massachusetts St.) and the University of Kansas. Delicious homemade breakfast that will give you a good start to the day. Helpful tourist information is provided by the owners upon request.
